questions.question: Is the beige sofa present with its original cushion arrangement?
questions.explanation: Based on Image B, the beige sofa is visible with three cushions arranged similarly to those in Image A. The cushions appear to have the same layout, indicating no change in their arrangement. By cross-examining Image A, the cushion arrangement is indeed identical, reinforcing the conclusion.

questions.question: Does the painting above the sofa retain its mountain silhouettes and tree outlines?
questions.explanation: Image B features a painting hanging above the sofa, depicting mountain silhouettes and tree outlines against a sunset sky. These visual elements are clear and prominent. In comparison, Image A also shows the same painting with consistent mountain and tree representations, confirming the unchanged nature of the painting in Image B.

questions.question: Is the potted plant with long green leaves present to the right of the sofa?
questions.explanation: Image B displays a potted plant with long green leaves situated to the right of the sofa. This visual detail is apparent and corresponds directly with the setting in Image A, where the same potted plant is positioned identically, indicating its presence remains unchanged.

questions.question: Is the woven rug still positioned under the sofa?
questions.explanation: The woven rug is visible under the sofa in Image B, identifiable by its texture and positioning. Upon reviewing Image A, the rug is similarly situated beneath the sofa, confirming it remains in place in Image B.

questions.question: Is the wood-paneled section of the wall visible next to the potted plant?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the wood-paneled section of the wall next to the potted plant on the right side is visible as part of the overall room decor. Likewise, Image A displays the same section, confirming its presence and unchanged visibility.
